title: Why did the USSR stop in the Winter War against Finland in 1940? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because they lost the war. They were stopped and could not proceed. According to Molotov, they lost one million men. Unfortunately, after winning the war, the Finns lost the peace. Stalin, as a dictator, dictated the peace agreement, and an ethnic cleansing in legitimate Finnish territory was conducted. That is one of the crimes against humanity, but not the only one that the USSR was guilty of. Far from being the only one.
